definition: adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: Officers, engineers and warrant officer engineers wore white overalls.
sentences.chinese: 軍官，技師和二級准尉機師穿產白色工裝褲。

sentences.english: The overalls I was wearing were of very thick cloth and no serious damage had been done.
sentences.chinese: 我穿的工裝褲料子很厚實，我的損傷不算嚴重。

sentences.english: Your jeans are dirty at the bottom because they touch the ground.
sentences.chinese: 你的工裝褲下邊髒了，因爲下邊蹭着地了。

sentences.english: I sewed a patch over the hole in my jeans .
sentences.chinese: 我給我工裝褲上的洞打了個補釘。

sentences.english: New overalls and helmets were dished out before the party went underground.
sentences.chinese: 這夥人到地下前，每人發一套新的工裝褲和鋼盔。

sentences.english: The breast pocket of his overalls was filled with tools.
sentences.chinese: 他工裝褲的胸袋裏裝滿了工具。

sentences.english: They began producing what they called "copper-riveted waist overalls."
sentences.chinese: 他們開始製作他們所謂的“銅鉚接齊腰工裝褲”。
